author: Jamil Shamoon
comment: It does the basic clock in and out fine,  but there is room for improvement.  You can see your history, but it does not provide totals.  It would also be great to have a pause/break button with a reminder for lunch time.   If you need a breakdown of your hours ask your company to send it from the desktop version.  This should be available in the app, but since it is not a supervisor needs to send it.  The good thing is that it only takes 1 click to email it.

author: Zack deluco
comment: Giant pain in the ass to use everyday

author: Randy Hogan
comment: Drains phone battery really fast

author: Michael Dowd
comment: It doesn't indicate on the main screen if you are currently logged in or out. There's no way to see how long you've been logged in. It has to have location activated in order to log in and out.  Just the same old crappy timecard app.

author: Daniel Kiah
comment: Must have ability to see total hours worked. This app is great for honest employee's but if i can't see my total hours worked i will request my employer drops this and finds something else for the 50+ employee's.

author: Bary Aviles
comment: You can't even check your punches after the fact to see if the hours are correct. If you can't trust your employees then don't hire them.

author: Mister Twinkey
comment: Crapp app feels like a invasion of privacy. It also makes you feel like an untrustworthy person that needs to be watched 24/7

author: Bradley Mebust
comment: It won't sync with my boss and is resulting in me never. Getting paid ridiculous application

author: Logan Sieling
comment: Forced to install by employer, invasion of privacy results in mistrust

author: David McWilliams
comment: This app's GPS system sucks and is VERY inaccurate.  It cost me my job by saying that my punch out was around the corner when I was standing right at the site.  I'm gonna speak to my lawyer to see what can be done about this.

author: jonathan Sampson
comment: My time rounded up at 7 after. This is illegal. If it happens again I am going to contact the labor board and file a complaint against Exakt time! This is illegal and breaks FLSA minimum wage and overtime requirements.

author: Roy Koehn
comment: An upgrade with the Android version would be quite helpful! Android could just copy iOS, but a few suggestions for some changes. When I'm viewing a history time record and I tap the back button, I would prefer not to be immediately sent back to the top of the page. It's just a pain to have to scroll down and try to find where I was viewing the history records! Also wouldn't mind having a 'Set to now' button when setting the time in the 'clock for' section... and would like to have total hours for days, weeks, etc.

author: Scott Kuperman
comment: Not very reliable. Constantly slow to update to match up with what guys in field are saying.Wish it had scheduling like T-Sheets.
Its ok sometimes new update is garbage
The worst

author: Ron Rodriguez
comment: Works great. Dont know what the negative reviews are for

author: Roadblock Thompson
comment: Literal garbage.  Completely Completely kills my battery and even when not using the app it inexplicably accesses my location data.  Save yourself the trouble and skip this install and any company that requires it.

author: Darcy W
comment: This is a useful and easy app. But! it needs a big "logout" button on the main page. All too often people forget to logout so the next in line has to do it. other than that it's a good app.

author: Matthew Hogeland
comment: This app is garbage. Great way for an employer to scam you out of hours/money
My company uses this app, you need to make a weekly, daily breakdown available.

author: uknowdadeal 21
comment: App fails to provide a break down of total hrs worked each day/week as well as other important information an employee might need to use for personal records. App should also allow for pto to be tracked. Please add these options. App also fails when transfering employee hours into certain quickbook software causing employees to be shorted hrs on check day. And if your boss is a stickler you may have a hard time convincing them the system is flawed and getting your hard earned money out of them

author: pete osborn
comment: App is strictly for employers. Keeps employee's in the dark. Can't see hours worked or time in and out.

author: Jamie Wool
comment: I don't understand how an app made for a phone in 2017 can skip out out time summary and hours worked daily/weekly but here we are and here it is if they change this and make it so you can see these things it goes front to 5 stars just like that

author: Dustin Baldwin
comment: Don't know why it clocks you out automatically after 12 hrs

author: jim bo
comment: Be aware this app allows use of camera and mic  at anytime without permission and you will not know it's in use

author: Wilfredo Vasquez
comment: Bad bad bad

author: logan nothaus
comment: Needs to show how many hours you worked for each day and the total for the week.  I figured this was standard for all time tracking apps.  Tsheets killed my battery but I like it better.

author: Jacob Kral
comment: Wastes so much battery, stays open all the time in the background consuming power. Pesters with constant notifications when battery low "plug in to continue crumbing" (your battery is low so here's constant push notifications).
title: Poor ui, battery killer, flawed activation system

author: Lance Do Work
comment: It won't let me see me history so how do I know how much I've worked this week or last week
title: Bullshit

author: Semere Tes
comment: Battery consumption

author: John Potter
comment: No means no!
title: Keeps asking to change location settings.

author: Matt Bowen
comment: Loses my hours. Drains my battery. Poor ease of access when not using GPS. Unreliable. Slow.
title: Needs work

author: Ayaaki Osawa
comment: 2 buttons: in and out. Zero info about when I clocked in and out, no hours worked, no way to generate a report for myself, clocking in requires a photo which uses data, what the F is this thing.
title: This app..

author: Khaled Fatthy
comment: Very useful and good usability for Labour's
title: Sales director

author: Eric Tuft
comment: Goodman Decorating
title: Eric Tuft

author: Florencio Maya
comment: Awesome....saves lots of time and headaches

author: Luke Templeman
comment: Just another government ran app! Facial recognition and keeping tabs on me 24/7
title: Bullshit

author: Justin Rousell
comment: There is no way to switch the syncing to manual. If you make a mistake in your clocking in/out there is no way to edit it because it has already been synced.  Please fix this problem
title: Good app,  sync problems

author: Jason Deskins
comment: As i have used this time clock i have found that it is easier than i first thought i it only took me two weeks of part time use to get it down and i love it even more this but it is not as simple as they make it sound for thoses of us that are not good with computers but in tracking time and job's i LOVE IT just wish it was simpler and not so complex
title: Owner

author: Brian Nalley
comment: Don't know if I'm clocked in. Can't find any of my information
